metadata.title: CVE-2018-15853 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
Endless recursion exists in xkbcomp/expr.c in xkbcommon and libxkbcommonbefore 0.8.1, which could be used by local attackers to crash xkbcommonusers by supplying a crafted keymap file that triggers boolean negation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-15853` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxkbcommon-x11-0 - 0.8.0-1ubuntu0.1
libxkbcommon0 - 0.8.0-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libxkbcommon package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.8.0-1ubuntu0.1').
